comment: An integer greater than 1 is a positive real number not equal to 0 or 1. Useful for working with integer logarithm bases (which is a common case, e.g. base 2, base 3 or base 10). (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 26-Sep-2017.) (Proof shortened by AV, 9-Jul-2022.)
